elements.description:
### ASQ Exercise Progress:
The ASQ exercise progress bar consists of a progress bar and a progress counter
(submissions/connected users).

The progress bar shows the cumulative viewers' activity states for the corresponding
exercise. Each user can be in one of the following activitystates: submitted, working,
focused or idle.
Those states are represented in 4 different colors as partial progress bars in the
order they were mentioned.

To display the gradient of change for a certain activity state (e.g submitted), 
we use a slightly bigger progress bar of the same style in the background of the main
progress bar. The faster the animation from left to right, the more activity occurred for
a given state in the last 5 seconds.

The presenter can choose if they want instant updates for the progress bar or
if the progress bar should update simultaneously with the momentum effect
by using the `directUpdate` property.


### Styling progress bar (in presenter's view):

The followings are available for styling (presenter's view):

Custom property                                    | Description                                 | Default
---------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------|----------
--asq-exercise-progress-height                     | The height of the progress bar              | 4px
--asq-exercise-progress-submitted-color            | The color of the submission bar.            | --google-green-500
--asq-exercise-progress-working-color              | The color of the working users bar.         | --paper-orange-500
--asq-exercise-progress-focused-color              | The color of the focused users bar.         | --paper-blue-200
--asq-exercise-progress-idle-color                 | The color of the idle users bar.            | --google-grey-500
--asq-exercise-progressbar-background-color        | The color of the empty progress bar.        | --google-grey-300
--asq-exercise-progress-num-mixin                  | The mixin to style the progress numbers of the progress bar. | { }


Examples:

- To change the submitted progress bar color:
      asq-exercise {
        --asq-exercise-progress-submitted-color: #e91e63;
      }

- To change the style of the progress numbers:
      asq-exercise {
        --asq-exercise-progress-progress-num-mixin: {
          font-size: 20px;
          padding: 2px;
        };
      }

properties.name: isASQElement
properties.description: True for every ASQ element.

properties.name: isASQQuestionTypeElement
properties.description: Denotes whether an ASQ element is a `question type`.

properties.name: _viewers
properties.description: Object that contains viewers with their activity information.

properties.name: _connectedViewersNum
properties.description: Counts the number of currently connected viewers.

properties.name: _submissionsNum
properties.description: Counts the number of submissions, inherited from asq-exercise.

properties.name: _submissionCounter
properties.description:
Counts the number of submissions during a given time interval
by the _visualizeChange function.

properties.name: _workingViewersNum
properties.description:
Counts the number of working users, calculated with the function given
in its computed property.

properties.name: _workingCounter
properties.description:
Counts the number of working users during a given time interval
by the _visualizeChange function.

properties.name: _focusedViewersNum
properties.description:
Counts the number of focused users, calculated with the function given
in its computed property.

properties.name: _focusedCounter
properties.description:
Counts the number of focused users during a given time interval
by the _visualizeChange function.

properties.name: _idleViewersNum
properties.description:
Counts the number of idle users, calculated with the function given
in its computed property.

properties.name: _idleCounter
properties.description:
Counts the number of idle users during a given time interval
by the _visualizeChange function.

properties.name: _update
properties.description: Flag to trigger the computed function at the right moment.

methods.name: _roleChanged
methods.description:
1. Validate role update. If the new value
is not a valid one, then roll back to the old value.

2. If the role of `outside` element is 
changed, then `inside` elements' role
are also changed.

methods.name: _computeSubmittedViewersNum
methods.description: Computes the amount of users that have submitted from the _viewers object.

methods.name: _computeWorkingViewersNum
methods.description: Computes the amount of working users from the _viewers object.

methods.name: _calcFlex
methods.description:
Returns a CSS declaration as a string to change the width of the progress bar
by changing its flex property.

methods.name: _makeSureViewerExists
methods.description:
If the given user is not already in the _viewers object, add him and notify
the observers that the _viewers object changed.

methods.name: _userWorked
methods.description: Mark the given user as working.

methods.name: _userFocused
methods.description: Mark the given user as focused.

methods.name: _userMadeTabVisible
methods.description: If the given user was idle, change his idle property and mark him as not idle.

methods.name: _userIdled
methods.description: Mark the given user as idle.

methods.name: _userMadeTabHidden
methods.description: If the given user was idle, change his idle property and mark him as not idle.

methods.name: _userBlurred
methods.description: If the given blurred, make sure that he's already in the _viewers object.

methods.name: _resetUser
methods.description: Reset all the activity properties of the given user.

methods.name: _userSubmitted
methods.description: Mark that the given user submitted and change the corresponding counter.

methods.name: _onConnectedClients
methods.description: Change the number of connected users.

methods.name: _onSessionEventBeamer
methods.description: Event handler for session event beamer events.

methods.name: _setVelocity
methods.description: Changes the css variable for the paper progress indeterminate cycle duration.

methods.name: _visualizeChange
methods.description: Animates the progress bar every 5 seconds depending on the activity.

methods.name: _calcChange
methods.description: Calculate the amount of change of a given activity.

return.desc: The amount of change in percent and in proportion to the number of users.

methods.name: _determineVelocity
methods.description: Get the velocity for the paper progress indeterminate cycle.

return.desc:
Returns a number in seconds for the duration of one paper progress
indeterminate cycle.

methods.name: _subscribeToEvents
methods.description: Subscribe to events to listen to them.

methods.name: _changeBackgroundProgressHeight
methods.description:
Dynamically adjusts the height of the backgorund effect. It's always two
pixel bigger than the height of the progress bar.

methods.name: _onQuestionType
methods.description: Handle question type events.

methods.name: _onRestorePresenter
methods.description:
Restore the number of submissions on the progress bar when the presenter
reloads.

attributes.name: is-a-s-q-question-type-element
attributes.description: Denotes whether an ASQ element is a `question type`.

elements.description: `asq-confidence` is used inside the `asq-exercise`, representing the confidence level of the students.

properties.name: isASQElement
properties.description: True for every ASQ element.

properties.name: isASQQuestionTypeElement
properties.description: Denotes whether an ASQ element is a `question type`.

properties.name: confidence
properties.description: Return the confidence level.

methods.name: _roleChanged
methods.description:
1. Validate role update. If the new value
is not a valid one, then roll back to the old value.

2. If the role of `outside` element is 
changed, then `inside` elements' role
are also changed.

attributes.name: is-a-s-q-question-type-element
attributes.description: Denotes whether an ASQ element is a `question type`.

elements.description:
`asq-exercise` groups ASQ `question types`. Every question should be be a child of an `asq-exercise` element. An `asq-exercise` element should contain one ore more `ASQ questions`. `asq-exercise` takes care of submitting and displaying progress for a group of questions. Example:

Exercise 1-1

Select a functional language.

 Haskell C Python Perl

Exercise 1

Official languages of Switzerland

 English French German Italian Rumantsch Different users will see different UI according to their **role**. There are several types of roles, `viewer`, `presenter` and `TA`. ###Styling `submit` and `edit` buttons (in viewer's view): To change the color and background color of `submit` button: asq-exercise { --asq-exercise-submit-button-color: white; --asq-exercise-submit-button-background-color: #388E3C; } To change the color and background color of `edit` button: asq-exercise { --asq-exercise-edit-button-color: white; --asq-exercise-edit-button-background-color: #FF7043; } To change the color and background color of `submit` button when disabled (a.k.a submissions are not allowed): asq-exercise { --asq-exercise-submit-button-disabled-color: #E0E0E0; --asq-exercise-submit-button-background-disabled-color: #424242; } Custom property | Description | Default -------------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------|---------- --asq-exercise-submit-button-color | The color of submit button | white --asq-exercise-submit-button-background-color | The background color of submit button | #388E3C --asq-exercise-edit-button-color | The color of edit button | white --asq-exercise-edit-button-background-color | The background color of edit button | #FF7043 --asq-exercise-submit-button-disabled-color | The color of submit button when disabled | #E0E0E0 --asq-exercise-submit-button-background-disabled-color | The background color of submit button disabled | #424242 To see how to style the progressbar, go to the asq-exercise-progress docs.

properties.name: isASQElement
properties.description: True for every ASQ element.

properties.name: isASQQuestionTypeElement
properties.description: Denotes whether an ASQ element is a `question type`.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description:
Disable or enable the element. Changes will be also
propagated to inner propagated elements.

properties.name: confidence
properties.description: Display confidence stars in the exercise

properties.name: maxNumSubmissions
properties.description: The maximum submission attempts allowed.

properties.name: assessment
properties.description: assessment type

properties.name: submissions
properties.description: Counter for submission times.

properties.name: _initialized
properties.description: Counter for submission times.

properties.name: directUpdate
properties.description: Flag  to update the progress bar directly.

methods.name: _roleChanged
methods.description:
1. Validate role update. If the new value
is not a valid one, then roll back to the old value.

2. If the role of `outside` element is 
changed, then `inside` elements' role
are also changed.

methods.name: _subscribeToEvents
methods.description:
Exercise is interested in two events: `asq:question_type`, which is emitted
when answer is submitted successfully, and `asq:question_type_edit`, which is emitted
when editing answer.

methods.name: submit
methods.description: The `submit` method will submit the answer to a wrapped 'asq-exercise' instance. Only useful when the `role` is viewer.

methods.name: _getQuestions
methods.description: Get all questions inside this exercise.

methods.name: _getSubmission
methods.description: Get all submission of all questions.

methods.name: _onEdit
methods.description: event handler for tapping the *edit* button.

methods.name: _disabledChanged
methods.description:
The `asq-disabled` event is fired when the value of *disabled* is
changed. This may be caused by clicking the *submit* button.

attributes.name: is-a-s-q-question-type-element
attributes.description: Denotes whether an ASQ element is a `question type`.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Disable or enable the element. Changes will be also
propagated to inner propagated elements.

attributes.name: confidence
attributes.description: Display confidence stars in the exercise

attributes.name: direct-update
attributes.description: Flag  to update the progress bar directly.

events.name: asq-submit
